{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3575457,"name":"Roger","username":"Rogerr079","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rogerr079/{size}/222096_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-31T20:48:03.123Z","cooked":"

I need to adjust the constraints of a trapezoid profile in auto, as i want it to go at a slower acceleration there. Should I do 2 different profiled PID controllers, or is there a way to dinamically adjust the trapezoid constraints?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-03-31T20:48:03.123Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":121,"readers_count":120,"score":39.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":497585,"topic_slug":"adjust-trapezoid-constraints-dinamically","display_username":"Roger","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63738,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"4403 Programming Lead"},"post_url":"/t/adjust-trapezoid-constraints-dinamically/497585/1","custom_user_title":"4403 Programming Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3575517,"name":"Ethan Grieshop","username":"CakeDeer6","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cakedeer6/{size}/264680_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-31T21:39:51.048Z","cooked":"

There’s a .setConstraints method for the controller in some languages. If there isn’t, you could always just create a new controller object. For example, in AutonInit you can run
pid = new ProfiledPidController(…, constraints1);
and then when you initialize in Teleop, run
pid = new ProfiledPidController(…,constraints2);

There is a method on the Profiled PIDs that allows you to change the constraints dynamically.
